meanings.definition: To press together or make more compact
meanings.sent1: I need to compress my clothes to fit them in the suitcase.
meanings.sent2: She used a vacuum bag to compress the blankets for storage.
meanings.sent3: Trying to compress all my belongings into one small bag was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to compress his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The machine can compress metal into different shapes.

meanings.definition: To reduce in size or volume
meanings.sent1: To save space, you can compress the files on your computer.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a heavy pan to compress the burger patty.
meanings.sent3: I tried to compress my essay, but it still exceeded the word limit.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to compress with each sad story she heard.
meanings.sent5: The pressure can compress the air inside the balloon.

meanings.definition: A folded or rolled-up cloth or pad applied to a part of the body to relieve inflammation
meanings.sent1: She placed a cold compress on her forehead to ease the headache.
meanings.sent2: The athlete used a compress to reduce the swelling in his knee.
meanings.sent3: The compress felt soothing against the sunburned skin.
meanings.sent4: The compress was infused with herbs for added healing benefits.
meanings.sent5: The nurse prepared a warm compress for the patient's sore muscles.
